docs.lead_paragraph: An Indiana proposal to allow fire stations and other public places to install "baby boxes" so mothers in crisis could anonymously surrender their newborns needs further review and is unlikely to advance this year, a key lawmaker said Tuesday.

headline.main: Indiana Senator: 'Baby Box' Proposal Needs Further Review
headline.print_headline: Indiana Senator: 'Baby Box' Proposal Needs Further Review

docs.snippet: An Indiana proposal to allow fire stations and other public places to install "baby boxes" so mothers in crisis could anonymously surrender their newborns needs further review and is unlikely to advance this year, a key lawmaker said Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: When President Barack Obama signed the Affordable Care Act five years ago, he visualized a time when the political hyperbole would be silenced and ordinary people would see that the health care law improved their lives.

headline.main: On 5th Anniversary of Health Care Law, No End to Debate
headline.print_headline: On 5th Anniversary of Health Care Law, No End to Debate

docs.snippet: When President Barack Obama signed the Affordable Care Act five years ago, he visualized a time when the political hyperbole would be silenced and ordinary people would see that the health care law improved their lives.
